title: Why Kherson, Bracing for Battle, Matters So Much to Russia and Ukraine
description: Both sides have given great weight to what happens in Kherson, a city of symbolic and strategic value, where conditions are increasingly dire for the thousands of people who remain.

title: At COP27, World Leaders Urge Faster Action on Climate Change
description: On the first day of COP27, the U.N. climate talks, world leaders urged each other to move faster to cut the pollution that is warming the planet while recognizing the war in Ukraine’s global energy effects and the unequal impacts of climate change to date.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: The U.S. Midterms Loom
description: Plus a warning at COP27 and Kherson in distress.

title: American Aid Worker Is Shot Dead in Baghdad
description: Security officials said that gunmen opened fire on the aid worker’s vehicle in a drive-by shooting in the central Baghdad neighborhood where he lived.

title: Even as Egypt Hosts Climate Summit, Selling Fossil Fuels Is a Priority
description: Desperate for cash as the fallout from the Ukraine war batters its economy, Egypt has been conserving natural gas at home to sell to Europe.

title: To Understand New Extremism, Look to History
description: Some of the forces protecting European nations even as far-right candidates thrive are not in play in the United States, and particularly not within a Republican establishment vulnerable to a takeover.

title: How Belize Is Trying To Save Its Coral Reef
description: Developing nations are reducing their debt by pledging to protect their resources in financial deals that could give them a bigger role in the fight against climate change.

title: Switzerland Is Paying Poorer Nations to Cut Emissions on Its Behalf
description: The agreements raise concerns that other countries will follow suit, delaying more difficult cuts of greenhouse gas emissions in wealthier nations.

title: Italy Blocks Male Migrants From Leaving Rescue Ships
description: The new right-wing government appears to be taking a harder line with people who are picked up in the Mediterranean as they try to cross from Libya.

title: Why Control of Kherson Is Important to Russia and Ukraine
description: Russian occupation officials may be reducing their presence in the southern city, but Ukraine says Moscow will still fight to retain it.

title: Does America Vote Too Much?
description: Elections have consequences that go beyond the results.

title: Climate Talks Open Amid Signs That Earth Is Hotter Than Ever
description: As world leaders gather in Egypt, data showed that the last eight years were on track to be the warmest on record. On the summit agenda is whether rich nations will pay for climate-related losses and damage.

title: Zelensky Warns of More Russian Mass Strikes on Infrastructure
description: Ukrainian officials are urging civilians to stock up on essentials and brace for a cold winter.

title: The World’s Most-Visited Glaciers Could Soon Be Gone
description: The U.N.’s cultural agency warns that ice sheets on Kilimanjaro, in the Dolomites and in Yosemite and Yellowstone may disappear by 2050, highlighting travel’s impact on climate change.

title: Countries Made Bold Climate Promises Last Year. How Are They Doing?
description: At last year’s U.N. climate summit in Glasgow, world leaders pledged to halt deforestation, phase out fossil fuel subsidies and offer up more climate aid. Following through has been tough.

title: A Messy Marital Split Tarnishes a Roman Soccer Legend
description: Francesco Totti and Ilary Blasi once shared a storybook love. Now she’s hiding his Rolexes, and he’s holding hostage her Jimmy Choos.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: The 27th annual U.N. climate talks opened yesterday in Egypt.

title: Even as Challenges Mount, Europeans Stick by Ukraine
description: Inflation and anxiety over nuclear weapons may be eating into some popular support for the war, but key governments remain insulated from the pressures for now.
